Name: attrelid
column6: the table this column belongs to

Name: atttypid
column6: the data type of this column

Name: attstattarget
column6: attstattarget controls the level of detail of statistics accumulated for this column by analyze. a zero value indicates that no statistics should be collected. the exact meaning of positive values is datatype-dependent. for scalar datatypes, attstattarget is both the target number of "most common values" to collect, and the target number of histogram bins to create.

Name: attlen
column6: this is a copy of the pg_type.typlen for this column's type.

Name: attnum
column6: the number of the column. ordinary columns are numbered from 1 up. system columns, such as oid, have (arbitrary) negative numbers.

Name: attndims
column6: number of dimensions, if the column is an array type; otherwise 0. (presently, the number of dimensions of an array is not enforced, so any nonzero value effectively means "it's an array".)

Name: attcacheoff
column6: always -1 in storage, but when loaded into a tuple descriptor in memory this may be updated to cache the offset of the attribute within the tuple.

Name: atttypmod
column6: atttypmod records type-specific data supplied at table creation time (for example, the maximum length of a varchar column). it is passed to type-specific input and output functions as the third argument. the value will generally be -1 for types that do not need typmod.

Name: attbyval
column6: a copy of pg_type.typbyval of this column's type

Name: attstorage
column6: a copy of pg_type.typstorage of this column's type

Name: attisset
column6: if true, this attribute is a set. in that case, what is really stored in the attribute is the oid of a tuple in the pg_proc catalog. the pg_proc tuple contains the query string that defines this set - i.e., the query to run to get the set. so the atttypid (see above) refers to the type returned by this query, but the actual length of this attribute is the length (size) of an oid. --- at least this is the theory. all this is probably quite broken these days.

Name: attalign
column6: a copy of pg_type.typalign of this column's type

Name: attnotnull
column6: this represents a not null constraint. it is possible to change this field to enable or disable the constraint.

Name: atthasdef
column6: this column has a default value, in which case there will be a corresponding entry in the pg_attrdef catalog that actually defines the value.
